{{MOS|date=June 2011}} {{BLP sources|date=July 2010}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Pritam Chakraborty | Born = 14 June 1971 (Age 40) [[Kolkata]], [[West Bengal]], [[India]] | image = Pritam C.jpg | caption = Pritam at Imran-Avantika's wedding reception. | image_size = | background = non_performing_personnel | origin = [[Kolkata]], [[West Bengal]], [[India]] | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Rock music|Rock]], [[Hip-Hop]], [[Dance]], [[R&B]] and [[Cinema of India|Indian Film]] Music | occupation = [[Composer]], [[Music Director]], [[Singer]], [[Arranger]], [[Instrumentalist]] and [[Record Producer]] | years_active = 1999âpresent | label = | associated_acts = [[Chandrabindoo (band)|Chandrabindoo]] }} '''Pritam Chakraborty''' ([[Bengali Language|Bengali]]: à¦ªà§à¦°à¦¿à¦¤à¦® à¦à¦à§à¦°à¦¬à¦°à§à¦¤à§), better known as '''Pritam''' is a music director and composer from [[Kolkata]] who currently works in [[Bollywood]], [[Mumbai]]. == Early life == Pritam was born on 14 June 1971 in [[Kolkata]] into a [[Bengali people|Bengali]] family to Prabodh Chakraborty, who runs a music school for children. He gained his early training in music from his father and learned to play the guitar in school. After completing his schooling at [[St. James' School (India)|St. James' School]] and college education at [[Presidency College, Kolkata|Presidency College]], he went to a music school. At Presidency he was the Social Services Secretary of the Students Union run by the Independents' Consolidation (IC). Pritam joined a [[Bangla]] band, [[Chandrabindoo (band)|Chandrabindoo]]. Before that he formed another band with his Presidency batchmates, called "Jotugriher Pakhi". They even have a cassette released to their credit at that time. In January 1993, Pritam joined the [[Film and Television Institute]] in [[Pune]] to undertake a course in [[sound recording]] and [[sound engineering]]. During this time, he was offered a chance to compose background music for a film {{Which?|date=August 2010}} by [[Hungarian people|Hungarian]] filmmaker [[Istvan Gaal]].{{Citation needed|date=August 2010}} He learned music theory, harmony and composition from ethnomusicologist and [[khyal]] singer Warren Senders, as well as briefly encountering principles of [[African Music]] from Senders and musicologist Kedar Avati. == Career == Having completed his education, Pritam moved to [[Mumbai]] to pursue a career in Bollywood. During his stay in Mumbai, he began composing ad jingles and became friendly with a number of other young men struggling to make it big like [[Shantanu Moitra]], [[Rajkumar Hirani]], [[Sanjay Gadhvi]] and [[Jeet Ganguly]], who played the guitar with [[Anup Jalota]]. Pritam got his first break when [[Sanjay Gadhvi]] was signed on to direct ''Tere Liye'' and he, in turn, signed on his friends Jeet and Pritam as music composers. Though the music was well received, the film sank at the box office. However, in 2002 [[Yashraj Films]] signed [[Sanjay Gadhvi]] up to direct ''[[Mere Yaar Ki Shaadi Hai]]'' for which the Pritam-Jeet duo once again composed the music. All the songs from that movie were chartbusters and the duo had hit the big time. His music comprises various kinds including Indian classical music and western influences. Pritam was then actively involved in mentoring and judging new talent on [[Zee TV]]'s singing competition show ''[[Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Challenge 2009]]''. == Solo career == After the separation with Jeet, Pritam's career as a solo musician stalled as he signed a series of flops like ''[[Fun2shh... Dudes in the 10th Century]]''. The film sank at the box office and Pritamâs music too. However, in 2004, Pritam composed the music for Sanjay Gadhvi's second film, ''[[Dhoom]]'', which was a runaway success. The film did well and the music topped the charts. Pritam followed up the success of ''[[Dhoom]]'' with a string of successful numbers after a year for ''[[Chocolate: Deep Dark Secrets|Chocolate]]'', ''[[Garam Masala (film)|Garam Masala]]'' and ''[[Gangster (film)|Gangster]]''. Also he composed the music for ''[[Dhoom 2]]'', the sequel to ''[[Dhoom]]'' and ''[[Life In A... Metro]]''. He composed the music for ''[[Singh Is Kinng]]'' and ''[[Kismat Konnection]]'' and formed a band named Metro. His most top rated musics are from the movies [[Dhoom]], [[Dhoom 2]], [[Life In A... Metro]], [[Gangster (film)|Gangster]], [[Bhool Bhulaiyaa]], [[Awarapan]], [[Dhan Dhana Dhan Goal]], [[Jab We Met]], [[Race (2008 film)|Race]], [[Woh Lamhe]], [[Jannat (film)|Jannat]], [[Singh Is Kinng]], [[Billu]], [[Love Aaj Kal]], [[Golmaal Returns]], [[Tum Mile]], [[Ajab Prem Ki Ghazab Kahani]], [[De Dana Dan]], [[Badmaash Company]], [[Raajneeti]], [[Once Upon A Time In Mumbaai]], [[Crook (film)|Crook]], [[Action Replayy]], [[Golmaal 3]], [[Dil Toh Baccha Hai Ji]], [[Dum Maaro Dum (film)|Dum Maaro Dum]], [[Ready (2011 film)|Ready]], [[Kucch Luv Jaisaa]], [[Mausam (2011 film)|Mausam]], [[Desi Boyz]], [[Players (film)|Players]] and more. He also composed the track for [[Hrithik Roshan]]'s TV debut, ''Just Dance''. == Accusations of plagiarism == Pritam has been accused of [[plagiarism]] on several occasions, wherein he has copied the music for a number of his most popular [[Bollywood|Hindi film]] songs from various artists from around the world, without giving credit to the original artists themselves.{{cite news|last=Sahu|first=Shambhu|title='I don't deny copying'|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/articleshow/384051.cms|accessdate=20 May 2011|newspaper=Times of India|date=9 November 2006}}{{cite news|last=Sawhney|first=Anubha|title=Bollywood music: If it's a hit, it's a rip-off|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2006-12-02/news-interviews/27794300_1_bollywood-music-pal-pritam-chakraborty|accessdate=20 May 2011|newspaper=Times of India|date=2 December 2006}}{{cite news|last=Sobhan|first=Usha|title=Plagiarism: Chord that strings Pritam's music|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/videos/64170/plagiarism-common-chord-that-strings-pritams-music.html|accessdate=20 May 2011|newspaper=CNN-IBN}} In one case he bought the copyright and gave credit too.{{cite news|title=Pritamâs the legitimate copy cat?|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Entertainment/Pritams_the_legitimate_copy_cat/rssarticleshow/2836831.cms|accessdate=20 May 2011|newspaper=Times of India|date=5 March 2008}} In 2009, producer [[Vipul Shah]] made Pritam sign an anti-plagiarism indemnity for his film ''[[Action Replayy]]''.Subhash K Jha. [http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/news-interviews/Pritam-cant-dare-to-copy-music/articleshow/4895709.cms#ixzz16Cm9M8vw Pritam can't dare to copy music!]. The Times of India. 15 August 2009. It has been widely claimed{{by whom|date=November 2011}} that Pritam plagiarized one of the most well-known tracks, ''Channo'' from the album ''[[Huqa Pani]]'' by Pakistani singer [[Ali Zafar]], for his song ''"Chori ki Baatein"'' in the film ''[[Fight Club (film)|Fight Club]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.itwofs.com/hindi-pritam.html|title=Chhoren ki baatein}} == Awards and nominations == He was nominated several times for [[Filmfare Award for Best Music Director]], [[Star Screen Award for Best Music Director]] and [[IIFA Best Music Director Award]] in the years 2007, 2008, 2009 and 2010. In 2010 He won the IIFA Award and the Apsara Producer's Guild Award for his music in ''[[Love Aaj Kal]]''.{{cite web|title=Pritam Chakraborty Awards|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/celebrities/awards/12496/index.html|publisher=Bollywood Hungama|accessdate=20 May 2011}} He also won the Radio Mirchi "Composer Of The Year Award" for his music in ''[[Ajab Prem Ki Ghazab Kahani]]''. In 2011 he won the Big Star Award for his song "Pee Loon" in ''[[Once Upon A Time In Mumbaai]]''. He also won [[The Global Indian Film and Television Honours]] award for "Special Music Director" for his music in ''[[Once Upon a Time in Mumbaai]]'' and Mirchi Music Listeners Choice "Album Of The Year" for the same. He also won Most Popular Music in Star Screen Award 2011 for ''[[Once Upon a Time in Mumbaai]]''. == Filmography == {{MOSLOW}} === As a music director === {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0"
